title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Thursday 3 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: tree protest arrest man after being released .
police and crime commissioner reacts to critical report of force .
vicious attack on man in rotherham .
watch : world war ii soldiers ' messages to sheffield .
sheffield mp : parliament should shape brexit plan .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it for live updates from today - we 'll be back from 08:00 on friday with more news , sport , weather and travel updates .
but if you 've not been following today , we 've distilled thursday into five key points to keep you up-to-date :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: more paramedics facing physical attacks
text: there 's been an increase in the number of physical and verbal attacks on front line ambulance staff in yorkshire .
figures from the ambulance service show there were 606 in 2015 - compared to 406 in 2013 .
staff have been punched , spat at and even threatened with knives while trying to help injured people .
prosecutions have followed some of the most serious incidents .
richard bentley works for yorkshire ambulance service :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: do not think of christmas too late
text: thanks to annie h for sending in this photo from frecheville .
autumn is upon us and it wo n't be long until we start seeing plastic cousins of this little chap on our christmas cakes .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: listen : danny wilson on chesterfield 's losing streak
text: the games have n't been going chesterfield 's way of late .
boss danny wilson has been speaking to bbc radio sheffield about their upcoming fa cup game against colchester :
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: weather update : dry for most overnight
text: rain clearing , a few showers in pennine areas overnight and a low of 7c .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: listen : testing time ahead , says barnsley boss heckingbottom
text: gone for a burton - an old expression meaning something 's gone wrong/been broken .
the reds are hoping their upcoming match goes better than that :
listen : # barnsleyfc boss paul heckingbottom on burton : 'it 's going to be a massive test . '
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: stark fireworks warning
text: a striking image is being used to warn people about keeping fireworks away from children in the run up to bonfire night .
south yorkshire police say the consequences of children playing with fireworks left around the home can be tragic .
have you bought fireworks for # bonfirenight ?
if so , please keep them in a safe place where your kids ca n't find them .
# darknights
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: video : custard pie attacks in sheffield city centre
text: a supertram driver was hit in the face with a custard pie and a cyclist knocked from his bike by pranksters carrying out a series of attacks in sheffield city centre .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: police recruit eastwood - no , not clint
text: he can run faster than any human , thanks to having four legs and being well a horse .
eastwood gets his name from the area where he 'll be used on patrol in the next few weeks , getting used to life on south yorkshire 's streets .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: phone boxes removed from rotherham
text: british telecom is planning to get rid of nearly 50 phone boxes throughout rotherham ,
twelve of them have n't made a single call in the last year .
almost 50 are being earmarked for closure across the borough , including boxes in the villages of wentworth , harthill , kiveton park and maltby .
the company says six out of 10 of their phone boxes across the uk are losing money .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: gang with weapons hunted after pub attack
text: a man 's been seriously injured in a gang attack in sheffield .
police say around 10 men assaulted a separate group of four men near to the washington pub in fitzwilliam street .
it is believed that the group of 10 men were armed with weapons , including knives .
they are described as being somalian and in their 20s .
a 25-year-old man from the other group suffered serious facial injuries and was taken to hospital ,
it 's believed a black fiat punto was travelling through the area at the time of the assault and officers are trying to trace its driver .
the incident happened around 01:30 on sunday morning and police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: breakingthree boys arrested over knife wounding
text: three teenage boys have been arrested following an assault at rotherham college yesterday lunchtime .
a 16-year-old boy suffered minor knife wounds in the incident .
three boys , two who are 16 and one who is 15 , have been bailed pending further enquiries .
police say they 're keeping a presence at the college to reassure students for the time being .

documents.title: sheffield mp : parliament should shape brexit plan
text: the government says it will appeal against a high court ruling that the prime minister ca n't trigger the official process of leaving the eu without holding a vote in parliament .
the landmark judgement opens up the possibility that mps and peers could block brexit , or at least delay it , plunging the process into chaos .
labour mp for penistone and stocksbridge angela smith says parliament should have a say on how we leave the eu :
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: lib dem slams police commissioner over new report
text: following news that south yorkshire police is one of the most inefficient forces in the country , the man who oversees the force is under fire for his performance .
dr alan billings , the south yorkshire police and crime commissioner , .
says there 's `` nothing surprising '' in the hmic report which finds the force requires improvement and 'has a limited understanding of likely future demand for its services ' .
`` this report is clear alan billings has now overseen two years of decline in this area .
this is not acceptable and the people of south yorkshire deserve better than this . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: mp urges government action over air quality
text: the government says it accepts a high court ruling that it 's not doing enough to reduce air pollution .
a judge agreed with environmental campaigners that the government 's air quality plan is inadequate - and wo n't ensure the uk meets european targets on nitrogen dioxide levels .
the government has written to local councils to urge them to do more .
but the labour mp for sheffield south east , clive betts , says there are some things only the government can do :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: radio sheffield 's rony goes back to the 80s !
text: now eat your heart out ali g , radio sheffield dj rony rocks that tracky-stylee way better , no ?
the station is going back to the 80s all day tomorrow , culminating in a special children in need fundraising live stage show .
we think rony got this from his wardrobe , and pretended it was from the fancy dress shop .
cooool baby !
author: Helen Bailey
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: improvements to wombwell park coming
text: barnsley council is clearly pleased to share some news about money going to people in wombwell to improve their local park .
other projects in the borough will benefit , not all of it is for parks .
fantastic news for residents of wombwell as broomhill park is set to receive £ 20,000 for improvements .
more info at
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: top-flight squash player sets up in barnsley
text: squash is a sport which yorkshire has a worldwide reputation for .
after all , the last two men 's singles finals at the commonwealth games have pitted two yorkshiremen against each other , nick matthew and james willstrop .
now , the current women 's world number two has decided to come and play her team squash in barnsley this season .
paul ogden has been to meet her :
author: Paul Ogden
BBC Sport

documents.title: vicious attack on man in rotherham
text: a man has been left with broken ribs and a punctured lung in an attack by bikers .

the 61-year-old victim and his wife were walking along the fields at the back of quarry field lane in wickersley on tuesday 25 october when two off-road bikers - who were part of a larger group - demanded he hand over his phone .
when he refused , they punched and kicked him , before stealing his mobile .

documents.title: listen : sheffield soldiers ' message home during ww ll
text: we 've been given a striking recording of men from south yorkshire who were serving in the far east in world war ll .
they were asked to record messages for their families , some of whom they had n't seen for years , as part of a project to boost moral which was called 'calling blighty ' .
author: Rony Robinson
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: police and crime commissioner reacts to critical report of force
text: `` no surprises '' .
that 's the view of south yorkshire police and crime commissioner dr alan billings on a new report which says south yorkshire police is one of the worst in the country when it comes to efficiency .

the report comes from her majesty 's inspectorate of constabulary and says the force 'requires improvement ' ; one area is that it 'has a limited understanding of likely future demand for its services ' .
the force needs good neighbourhood policing if it is to manage crime and anti-social behaviour .
it also needs better planning for future demand .
when i appointed the present chief constable he was given a clear brief to get all this right . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: police seize firearm from doncaster traveller site during crackdown operation
text: a firearm has been seized from a doncaster traveller site , as part of an ongoing operation to tackle armed criminality in the borough .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: watch : 'steamy ' video
text: wendy scott captured some unusual video this morning - thanks for sharing it .
makes me want to put the kettle on any excuse .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid a misty morning at ladybower reservoir .
it looks like it 's steaming .
# derbyshire # sheffield
wendy can we share this on facebook ?
amy x
yes of course amy .
thank you !
could you try emailing it to me if it 's not too much trouble !
amy.nagy @ bbc.co.uk x
i 've e mailed it amy plus sent it via fb messenger x
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: watch : extraordinary rickshaw challenge teenager
text: andrew davies from chesterfield is taking part in something pretty strenuous - the one show 's rickshaw challenge .
the 18-year-old has faced a tough battle himself with blood cancer - and he 's raised a large amount of money he raised for the children 's hospital in sheffield .
the rickshaw team will cover well over 400 miles this year , and andrew tells us he ca n't wait to get stuck in :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: south yorkshire police efficiency poor says report
text: an official inspection has found that south yorkshire police is one of the worst forces in the country for efficiency .
they are classed as 'requires improvement ' by her majesty 's inspectorate of constabulary .
they say south yorkshire police do n't plan well enough for possible trouble - and they do n't work hard enough to prevent crime .
we are already acting on the areas highlighted as requiring improvement by hmic , in line with the recommendations provided .
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: listen : barnsley poppy appeal organiser on fifa dispute
text: we know that england and scotland players plan to wear the poppy on armbands at their forthcoming match .
the football associations of england and scotland say they will defy fifa 's ban on players wearing poppies when the teams meet on armistice day .
the fa say they 're willing to accept any punishment .
goff griffiths ( below ) from barnsley has volunteered with the royal british legion for the last 19 years :
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: breakingcourt victory for campaigners over brexit
text: campaigners have won their high court battle over theresa may 's decision to use the royal prerogative in her brexit strategy .
the uk government is seeking permission to appeal the court ruling .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: listen : the boy who makes sports journalists nervous
text: rhys kidd is a lad with ambition .
the 13-year-old is one of the winners of the bbc school report after he made a report about his beloved sheffield united .
rhys impressed the judges by writing a great inter-generational story of how supporting sheffield united affects his life and that of his family .
he 's won the chance to take part in bbc radio sheffield 's coverage of the fa cup this weekend , and popped in to see toby foster today :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: watch : yobs run amok hurling fireworks at cars and shops in sheffield suburb
text: these were the scenes on a sheffield street earlier this week and yobs hurled fireworks at shops and cars .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: tree protest arrest man after being released
text: this is one of the two men arrested yesterday as a group of campaigners blocked contractors from felling an old tree in nether edge , sheffield .
it 's believed the contracting company , amey , called police and urged them to act to end the protest .
the tree maintenance programme has gone through the courts several times .
'7 hours in a windowless cell ' sheffield tree campaigner calvin payne arrested and released without charge yesterday @ twitterid
bravo @ twitterid such a shame that it 's come to this .
@ twitterid
ouch .
still go see a solicitor .
surly it amounts to unlawful detention
to be fair , not many cells have much of a view
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: travel alert : north on the m-one warning
text: on the .
m1 in west yorkshire - heavy traffic northbound at j39 , a636 ( wakefield ) , because of an accident earlier on .
approach with care .
all lanes have been re-opened .
badly congested to j37 , a628 ( barnsley ) .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: how long do you spend in the shower ? savings claim made
text: citizens advice in barnsley is sharing something that caught our eye .
no photos please , but how long do you spend in the shower and could you easily be a bit quicker ?
food for thought .
if 25 percent of the uk spent one minute less in the shower every day , we 'd save £ 56m .
more facts : # besw2016
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: weather in video
text: the weather ahead for today with abbie a chance of rain it seems
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: video update : snake not on a plane in a car
text: keith the snake is reunited with his owner in sheffield .
he took the people who bought his owner 's car by surprise cos he somehow got himself into the car .
have a look at how this unfolded :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: good morning
text: corking snap to kick us off this thursday , it comes from poppy who took it in sheffield , not sure where .
anyone ?
we have news , sport weather and travel across the day .
your and stories welcome as ever , just click here to send .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield
